title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement phgrosjean@sciviews.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Get a LaTeX equation from a model — equation
code: equation(object, ...)  # S3 method for default equation(object, ...)  # S3 method for character equation(object, ...)  eq__(object, ...)  eq_(object, ...)  # S3 method for inline_equation print(x, ...)

title: Get a LaTeX equation from a model — equation
text: object object model whose equation constructed. character object provided, concatenated single character string equation class, otherwise non transformed (supposed valid LaTeX equation). Remember backslashes must doubled regular R strings, use r"(...)" notation, may comfortable , see examples. ... parameters passed equatiomatic::extract_eq() (see man page). x inline_equation object generated eq_().`

title: Get a LaTeX equation from a model — equation
text: object class c("equation", "character").

title: Get a LaTeX equation from a model — equation
text: slight differences equation(), eq_() eq__(): equation() returns string LaTeX code prints LaTeX code R console. eq_() returns LaTeX code surrounded dollar sign $...$ suitable build inline equations R Markdown/Quarto documents using inline R code. prints rendered inline equation RStudio Viewer browser. advised rapidly preview resulting equation. eq__() returns LaTeX code surrounded dollar signs simple character string. just prompts LaTeX string R console. used R inline chunk inside $$...$$ construct Markdown text. result display equation can also cross referenced Quarto usual way label , e.g., use $$...$$ {#eq-label}.

title: Get a LaTeX equation from a model — equation
code: iris_lm <- lm(data = iris, Petal.Length ~ Sepal.Length + Species) summary(iris_lm) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = Petal.Length ~ Sepal.Length + Species, data = iris) #>  #> Residuals: #>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max  #> -0.76390 -0.17875  0.00716  0.17461  0.79954  #>  #> Coefficients: #>                   Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)       -1.70234    0.23013  -7.397 1.01e-11 *** #> Sepal.Length       0.63211    0.04527  13.962  < 2e-16 *** #> Speciesversicolor  2.21014    0.07047  31.362  < 2e-16 *** #> Speciesvirginica   3.09000    0.09123  33.870  < 2e-16 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 0.2826 on 146 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.9749,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9744  #> F-statistic:  1890 on 3 and 146 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16 #>  equation(iris_lm) #> $$ #> \operatorname{Petal.Length} = \alpha + \beta_{1}(\operatorname{Sepal.Length}) + \beta_{2}(\operatorname{Species}_{\operatorname{versicolor}}) + \beta_{3}(\operatorname{Species}_{\operatorname{virginica}}) + \epsilon #> $$ # Providing directly the LaTeX code of the equation (variance of a sample) equation("S^2_y = \\sum_{i=1}^{n-1} \\frac{(y_i - \\bar{Y})^2}{n}") #> $$ #> S^2_y = \sum_{i=1}^{n-1} \frac{(y_i - \bar{Y})^2}{n} #> $$ # Easier to write like this (avoiding the double backslashes): eq1 <- equation(r"(S^2_y = \sum_{i=1}^{n-1} \frac{(y_i - \bar{Y})^2}{n})") # Print raw text: eq1 #> $$ #> S^2_y = \sum_{i=1}^{n-1} \frac{(y_i - \bar{Y})^2}{n} #> $$ # Get a preview of the equation eq__(eq1) #> [1] "S^2_y = \\sum_{i=1}^{n-1} \\frac{(y_i - \\bar{Y})^2}{n}" # The same function can be used inside a `$$...$$ {#eq-label}` construct in # R Markdown or Quarto to calcule a display equation that is also recognized # by the cross referencing system of Quarto. # Get a string suitable for inclusion inline in R Markdown with `r eq_(eq1)` # (inside Markdown text and without the dollar signs around it) eq_(eq1)

text: tabularise() constructs flextable object. text: equation(), equation.default() equation_character() added extract equations several objects. eq_() eq__() added ease inclusion R-computed equations R Markdown Quarto documents. eq_() also allows preview equation RStudio viewer pane, web browser. print.paragraph() nicely displays preview Markdown paragraph (Viewer panel RStudio). bug para_md() allowed interpret sometimes content LaTeX equations Markdown text, led strange results. Now, LaTeX equations $...$ protected quadruple back ticks triple dollars side, thus, viewed code chunks Markdown interpreter, consequently, left intact. Code added tabularise() prevent Quarto generate error missing caption labeled chunk want one, , chunk label start “tbl-”.
